meanings.definition: In a bad-tempered or irritable manner.
meanings.sent1: She splenetically slammed the door after an argument with her brother.
meanings.sent2: He spoke splenetically about the poor service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed splenetically when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds moved splenetically across the sky, foretelling a storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher scolded the students splenetically for not completing their homework.

meanings.definition: Showing or expressing anger or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Her splenetically worded email made her frustration clear.
meanings.sent2: The splenetic customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent3: The splenetic cat knocked over a vase in protest of being ignored.
meanings.sent4: His splenetic outburst startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The splenetic driver honked loudly at the slow-moving car in front of him.
